business.headline: Bitcoin rallies past $81,000. What's driving the surge?Bitcoin surged past $81,000 for the first time, hitting a record high on Monday with its market cap reaching $1.6 trillion.
Rupee plunges to all-time low of 84.38 against US dollarThe rupee dropped to a new low of 84.3875 in early trading, surpassing its previous record set last Friday.

Swiggy IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check status Investors who have bid for Swiggy IPO can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd, the registrar for the issue.
Sensex, Nifty open flat despite gains in IT and auto stocks The S&P BSE Sensex was down 48.63 points to 79,437.69, while the Nifty50 lost 20.40 points to 24,127.80.

Ruchir Sharma on why billionaires support 'crazy capitalist' Donald TrumpDespite his 'crazy capitalist' persona, Donald Trump's pro-business approach continues to win over America's influential elites and billionaires.

Cryptocurrencies here to stay as an asset class, says Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma explained why cryptocurrencies, alongside gold, are emerging as long-term alternatives to traditional assets, particularly the US dollar.

China's stimulus may stabilise economy, but won't solve crisis: Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma highlighted that China's growth is unlikely to exceed 2.5% annually over the next decade.

Only a weaker dollar will bring foreign investors back to India: Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma explained that the primary factor hindering foreign capital inflows into India is the strength of the dollar.

Should India worry about Donald Trump's tariff plans? Ruchir Sharma explainsRuchir Sharma warned that under Donald Trump, India must brace for a more transactional approach, where deals could be made based on America's interests.

Booking plans job cuts as part of company's reorganisation planBooking Holdings, which owns brands like Booking.com and Kayak, did not disclose how many jobs would be affected but said it expected to provide more details on timing, likely impact on employees and financials "in due course".

Elon Musk's Tesla hits $1 trillion market value after Trump winThe electric automaker's shares jumped 8.2 per cent to $321.22, catapulting the company's valuation above the trillion-dollar mark for the first time in more than two years.

A woman's soulmate is another woman: Kalli Purie at Business Today MPW 2024Kalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, delivered the vote of thanks at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 awards.

Watch: Trailblazers awarded at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024Business Today unveiled the 21st edition of its Most Powerful Women in Business list on Friday, celebrating 60 exceptional women leaders who are pioneering change, driving growth, and inspiring progress across diverse industries. This year's edition brings in 12 fresh faces and recognises four returning achievers, underscoring the dynamic nature of leadership in business. Watch the award ceremony here on India Today.

I salute the trailblazers: Kalli Purie at Business Today's Most Powerful Women eventKalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, lauded the growing accomplishments and transformation of women leaders in India.

Trailblazers on Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 listThis year's Business Today Most Powerful Women list introduces 12 new faces, four returning achievers, and 37 repeat honourees from last year. Two trailblazers entered the MPW Hall of Fame after seven-time wins.

Americans can learn a lesson or two from India: Piyush Goyal on women representationUnion Minister of Commerce & Industry Piyush Goyal lauded India's approach to women's empowerment and said that Americans can learn a lesson or two from India on women representation.

Harley-Davidson tariffs to be cut after Trump's return? Piyush Goyal respondsSpeaking at the Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Piyush Goyal expressed India's openness to reconsidering the tariffs on the iconic motorcycles.

Women leaders share insights on achieving work-life balance and success at BT MPW 2024At the Business Today MPW 2024 session, Ritu Arora, CEO & CIO of Allianz Investment Management, Asia Pacific, Nirupa Shankar, Joint MD of Brigade Group; and Devita Saraf, Chairperson & CEO of Vu Group, shared insights on striking a fine balance between work, life, health and wealth.

Women need to move from being savers to investors: Radhika GuptaSpeaking at the Business Today Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Radhika Gupta, MD and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, emphasised the need for women to move beyond saving and start investing.

It's not complicated: Radhika Gupta urges women to manage their own moneySpeaking at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Edelweiss Mutual Fund Managing Director and CEO Radhika Gupta said that while women have been the "chief financial officers" of their households for generations, it's time to extend that role into the financial markets.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Justice Sanjiv Khanna takes oath as 51st Chief Justice of IndiaJustice Khanna's name was recommended by Justice DY Chandrachud, who retired from the post on November 10 at the age of 65. He will serve as the Chief Justice of India till May 13 next year.

Gautam Gambhir hits out at Ricky Ponting over Virat Kohli criticismIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir has backed senior players Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli amid their poor form and said that Ricky Ponting should only focus on Australian cricket.

Donald Trump spoke to Putin, told him not to escalate war in Ukraine: ReportAccording to a report by The Washington Post, Trump took the call from his resort in Florida, and advised Putin not to escalate the war in Ukraine. He also reminded Putin of Washington's sizeable military presence in Europe

Who is Arsh Dalla, Khalistani terrorist and Nijjar aide, arrested in Canada? Arsh Dalla has been leading the banned Khalistan Tiger Force (KTF) since the killing of Khalistani terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar last year.

Yogendra Yadav criticises Air India, shares 'very sad experience' with airline In a post on X, Yogendra Yadav shared that while he usually avoids posting personal grievances publicly, this incident with Air India "is worth recording" as it "may be of use to others."

Jadavpur University professor found dead with throat slit in Uttarakhand hotelMainak Pal, a professor in the Philosophy Department at Jadavpur University, was found dead in the washroom of a hotel in Uttarakhand, with deep cuts on his neck and hands.

How MVA compelled Mahayuti to scale up revdi promises in MaharashtraIn the fight for Maharashtra, India's richest state, there is a bitter battle of 'revdis'. The BJP-led Mahayuti has been forced to promise higher cash dole after big guarantees by the Congress-led Maha Vikas Aghadi. Here's a look at who's promising what ahead of the Maharashtra Assembly election.

Biden should resign to make Harris first woman US President, says former aideJamal Simmons, Kamala Harris's former communications director, argued that the move would turn the tables on Donald Trump, who defied projections to win his second term as US President.
Snow returns to Mount Fuji as satellite watches from aboveThe delayed snowfall has raised concerns about the impacts of climate change on Japan's highest peak.

BJP amplifies 'ek hain toh safe hain' slogan with newspaper ad in MaharashtraPrime Minister Narendra Modi's slogan 'Ek hain toh safe hain' (Together, we are safe), aimed at criticising Congress for divisive politics, became a focal point of the BJP's Assembly election campaign in Maharashtra.

My Goa tourism post went viral because…: Entrepreneur slams police complaintA viral post on Goa's tourism decline has led to a police complaint and an open letter from Ramanuj Mukherjee, who alleged tourists "felt cheated" and urged Chief Minister Pramod Sawant for reforms.

Video: Israel finds massive Hezbollah tunnel under cemetery in LebanonHezbollah's hidden compound was dismantled as hundreds of trucks and concrete mixers poured approximately 4,500 cubic meters of concrete into the facility.

Watch: Navjot Singh Sidhu back on Kapil's show, puzzled Archana Puran Singh reactsNavjot Singh Sidhu is set to reunite with The Great Indian Kapil show after five years. The former cricketer will appear in the upcoming episode of the Netflix show.

Racist texts invoking slavery sent to Black men, women across US, probe onThe messages were reported in several states, including New York, Alabama, California, Ohio, Pennsylvania and Tennessee. They generally used a similar tone but varied in wording.

Jasprit Bumrah will lead India if Rohit Sharma is unavailable: Coach Gautam GambhirBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: India head coach Gautam Gambhir has confirmed that Jasprit Bumrah will lead India if Rohit Sharma misses the first Test against Australia in Perth.
Bitcoin rallies past $81,000. What's driving the surge?Bitcoin surged past $81,000 for the first time, hitting a record high on Monday with its market cap reaching $1.6 trillion.

Trump golfs with granddaughters after win, 'uncle status' Elon Musk joins"Elon achieving uncle status," Kai Trump wrote in a post on X after the billionaire made a guest appearance at the family golf outing.

Congress suspends 22 rebel candidates in Maharashtra for anti-party activitiesProminent leaders suspended for six years include former minister Rajendra Mulak from Ramtek, Yagnyavalk Jichkar from Katol, Kamal Vyawhare from Kasba, Manoj Shinde from Kopri Pachpakhadi, and Aaba Bagul from Parvati.

Will quit if proven: Siddaramaiah on excise funds being used in Maharashtra pollsThe Karnataka Chief Minister's response was to PM Modi's charge that the Congress was collecting Rs 700 crore from liquor shop owners to fund the party's election campaign in Maharashtra.

Sri Lankan Airlines' Ramayana ad strikes a chord with Indians: 'Got goosebumps'The five-minute advertisement invites viewers on a 'Ramayana Trail' and them on a journey through the iconic locations connected to the Hindu epic, Ramayana.

First painting by humanoid robot sold at an auction for over $1 millionA humanoid robot artist named Ai-Da made headlines by selling a painting for over $1 million at a Sotheby's auction, sparking conversations about technology's role in creativity.

Hyderabad man shoots girlfriend's father for sending her to USThe woman's father sustained an eye injury after the accused shot him with the air gun. The incident took place when the 57-year-old was sitting inside his car.

Rupali Ganguly's stepdaughter calls her father unsupportive, bully in new videoIn a new emotional video posted on social media, Rupali Ganguly's stepdaughter levelled new accusations against the actor and her father, calling them 'bullies.' She also accused her father of being unsupportive and mocking her mental health struggles.

What difference does social media make: Gambhir 'not feeling the heat' after NZ lossIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir has shrugged off social media criticism after a tumultuous start to his coaching tenure of the Indian Cricket Team.

Singh Is Kinng 2 in the works without Akshay Kumar, producer wants Ranveer SinghProducer Shailendra Singh has made it clear that his first choice for Singh Is Kinng 2 is Ranveer Singh, and if things don't materialise with him, he will approach Diljit Dosanjh. Here's more about the project.

Singham Again box office: 3rd film of 2024 to cross Rs 300 crore mark globallySingham Again box office collection: The Ajay Devgn film crossed the Rs 300 crore mark globally in its second weekend, becoming the third film of 2024 to do so. Kartik Aaryan's Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 also hit a similar milestone in its second weekend.

Kamal Haasan says no to all titles including UlaganayaganKamal Haasan shared a statement regarding the titles and prefixes that fans had given him. He mentioned that he wants to be called by his name and not by any titles.

Bigg Boss 18 Day 34: Avinash Mishra, Digvijay Rathee fight over bathroom dutiesIn the latest episode of Bigg Boss 18, Digvijay Rathee called out Avinash Mishra for not cleaning the bathroom. This led to a heated argument between the two.

sports.headline: Gautam Gambhir presser full text: What the coach said before Australia tourBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Before departing for Australia, India head coach Gautam Gambhir addressed a press conference in Mumbai, confidently fielding tough questions with straightforward—and blunt—answers. However, he left fans disappointed by not confirming Rohit Sharma's availability for the first Test.

Gerald Cooetzee is getting some IPL attention: Dale Steyn hails all-round heroicsDale Steyn hailed Gerald Cooetzee for his all-round heroics vs India in the T20I series so far. Steyn said that the all-rounder would be on the radar of IPL franchises ahead of the IPL 2025 mega auction.

Dinesh Karthik demands Varun Chakravarthy's selection for Champions Trophy 2025Former India wicketkeeper batter Dinesh Karthik has asked for wrist spinner Varun Chakravarthy's selection in the team for the Champions Trophy 2025.

Gautam Gambhir plays down pressure, backs Virat and Rohit to shine in AustraliaAhead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Australia, India's head coach Gautam Gambhir attended a press conference in Mumbai, where he confidently addressed tough questions. While he defended under-pressure captain Rohit Sharma and star batter Virat Kohli, affirming their "incredible hunger" to perform, Gambhir did not confirm Rohit's availability for the first Test.

What difference does social media make: Gambhir 'not feeling the heat' after NZ lossIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir has shrugged off social media criticism after a tumultuous start to his coaching tenure of the Indian Cricket Team.

Virat Kohli arrives in Perth ahead of 1st Test, squad coming in batchesVirat Kohli landed in Perth ahead of the 1st Test vs Australia, starting November 22. The jumbo squad left in two batches and Kohli was the first Indian player to arrive in Australia.

Jasprit Bumrah will lead India if Rohit Sharma is unavailable: Coach Gautam GambhirBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: India head coach Gautam Gambhir has confirmed that Jasprit Bumrah will lead India if Rohit Sharma misses the first Test against Australia in Perth.

India coach Gautam Gambhir hopeful of Rohit Sharma's participation in Perth TestTeam India head coach Gautam Gambhir was hopeful about captain Rohit Sharma's availability for the 1st Test vs Australia. The Indian captain might miss the Perth Test for personal reasons.

Gautam Gambhir hits out at Ricky Ponting over Virat Kohli criticismIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir has backed senior players Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli amid their poor form and said that Ricky Ponting should only focus on Australian cricket.

Bring Ramandeep on at number 8: Uthhappa after India's Gqeberha lossRobin Uthappa suggests India should bring in Ramandeep Singh at No. 8 to bolster their lower-order batting depth, a missing element that contributed to their T20I loss against South Africa. His all-round capabilities could prove crucial in upcoming matches.

Highlights: Will Rohit Sharma play Perth Test? What coach Gautam Gambhir saidGautam Gambhir Press Conference Highlights: India men's team head coach Gautam Gambhir has addressed Rohit Sharma's participation, India's challenging Australia tour and the form of Virat Kohli in a pre-departure press conference before leaving for Australia ahead of the high-octane Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Jasprit Bumrah will lead India if Rohit Sharma is unavailable: Coach Gautam GambhirBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: India head coach Gautam Gambhir has confirmed that Jasprit Bumrah will lead India if Rohit Sharma misses the first Test against Australia in Perth.

His all-round capabilities could prove crucial in upcoming matches.

What coach Gautam Gambhir saidGautam Gambhir Press Conference Highlights: India men's team head coach Gautam Gambhir has addressed Rohit Sharma's participation, India's challenging Australia tour and the form of Virat Kohli in a pre-departure press conference before leaving for Australia ahead of the high-octane Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

South Africa played terrible shots: Boucher critical despite Stubbs' brillianceFormer South Africa player Mark Boucher believed that the team played terrible shots to make their life difficult in a 125-run chase against India. Boucher lauded Tristan Stubbs, who kept a cool head and guided SA to a victory.

Bacho ne kamaal kia: Shoaib Akhtar hails Pakistan's ODI series win over AustraliaShoaib Akhtar hailed Pakistan's ODI series win over Australia and praised the pace trio of Naseem Shah, Shaheen Afridi and Haris Rauf. Pakistan created history by beating Australia in an ODI series after 22 years.

Jos Buttler powers England to 7-wicket win and take 2-0 lead vs West IndiesJos Buttler's blazing 83 from 45 balls powered England to a commanding win by 7 wickets against West Indies.  England lead the 5-match T20I series 2-0 vs the hosts.

Premier League: Arsenal draw Chelsea 1-1 in London DerbyChelsea and Arsenal played out a tense 1-1 draw at Stamford Bridge on Sunday, leaving both London clubs level in the Premier League but still nine points behind league leaders Liverpool.

Inzamam wants India to play Champions Trophy in Pakistan: No threat hereFormer Pakistan captain Inzamam Ul Haq has claimed that India will be well taken care of in Pakistan. Inzamam has urged the team to visit Pakistan in the Champions Trophy and said that there is no threat to the cricket team.

Stubbs opens up on special Gqeberha knock vs India on 'Mom's Birthday'Tristan Stubbs led South Africa to victory over India with a composed, match-winning 47*, showcasing grit under pressure, especially with his mother present for her birthday. Varun Chakravarthy's brilliant five-for went in vain as India failed top defend such a low-total.

Varun Chakravarthy rues 2nd T20I loss: Wanted to win match on son's birthdaySouth Africa vs India: Spinner Varun Chakravarthy rued the result of India's 2nd T20I match despite taking a 5-wicket-haul in Gqeberha. Varun said that he wanted India to win on his son's birthday.

Lockie Ferguson hat-trick helps New Zealand defend their lowest score SL vs NZ: Lockie Ferguson and Glenn Phillips picked up three wickets apiece as New Zealand beat Sri Lanka by five runs on Sunday. The two-match T20I series ended at 1-1.

Inzamam wants India to play Champions Trophy in Pakistan: No threat hereFormer Pakistan captain Inzamam Ul Haq has claimed that India will be well taken care of in Pakistan. Inzamam has urged the team to visit Pakistan in the Champions Trophy and said that there is no threat to the cricket team.

Stubbs opens up on special Gqeberha knock vs India on 'Mom's Birthday'Tristan Stubbs led South Africa to victory over India with a composed, match-winning 47*, showcasing grit under pressure, especially with his mother present for her birthday. Varun Chakravarthy's brilliant five-for went in vain as India failed top defend such a low-total.

Varun Chakravarthy rues 2nd T20I loss: Wanted to win match on son's birthdaySouth Africa vs India: Spinner Varun Chakravarthy rued the result of India's 2nd T20I match despite taking a 5-wicket-haul in Gqeberha. Varun said that he wanted India to win on his son's birthday.

Lockie Ferguson hat-trick helps New Zealand defend their lowest score SL vs NZ: Lockie Ferguson and Glenn Phillips picked up three wickets apiece as New Zealand beat Sri Lanka by five runs on Sunday. The two-match T20I series ended at 1-1.

Varun Chakravarthy becomes 5th Indian to take up 5-wicket-haul in T20IsIndia spinner Varun Chakravarthy became only the 5th Indian to take a 5-wicket-haul in T20Is. Varun's incredible spell completely changed the complexion of the 2nd T20I.

Varun Chakravarthy five in vain as South Africa level series 1-1SA vs IND, 2nd T20I: South Africa drew level in the four-match series after winning by three wickets on Sunday at the St George's Park in Gqeberha. Varun Chakravarthy picked up five wickets but his efforts went in vain.

Watch: 1st batch of India players leave for Australia for Border Gavaskar TrophyThe first batch of India players left for Australia ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. India play Australia in 5 Test matches, with the first one starting on November 22 in Perth.

Auditioning for Australia: Hardik slammed for slow knock in 2nd T20IIndian cricket fans criticised Hardik Pandya for a poor show with the bat in the 2nd T20I vs South Africa, Hardik scored 39 off 45 after India had lost a flurry of top-order wickets.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
